content.original: Argent Leviathan was commissioned by ComStar in 3060 as an exploratory upgrade to existing King Crabs. Largely driven by the logistical problems plaguing ComStar's thinly stretched armies, the KGC-AL prototype would carry eight extended range medium lasers and two large pulse lasers along with functional claws that would enable it to drag large battlefield salvage or even grasp its prey. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.22

content.original:
The Clint was first created in 2607 as a direct result of the Star LeagueArmaments Act, a law meant to provide border areas with the latest in battlefield technology. The next version, CLNT-2-3T, was mass produced starting in 2608. The Clint was primarily designed as a cheap recon unit, with the capabilities of a well-armed, low-end medium weight 'Mech, and in this regard it served well. With a top speed of 97.2 km/h and a jumping capability of one hundred and eighty meters, the Clint can easily keep up with other recon elements and maneuver through mountainous or urban terrain. Its Sloan 220 Lockover T&T System in particular shines as it is simple to use and provides the pilot with excellent battlefield data. Although the 'Mech has limited ammunition reserves for its autocannon, the Sloane 220 ensures that whatever the Clintshoots at, it hits. Quirk: Variable Range Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

content.original: The Kugelblitz, also known as the Hypernova, Superluminous Supernova, or 'Type 1A Supernova' is a gigantic Supernova chassis. Nothing really out of the ordinary until one checks the armor plating on it, mounting WarShip class 'Ferro-Carbide Lamellor', this expensive armor is capable of protecting a 'Mech's internals without issue, but the price to maintain the armor is something even the richest of Clan Diamond Shark might have an issue with. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.38

The variant piloted by Phelan Wolf at his Trial of Position to test out as a MechWarrior on 21 July 3051. Configured by Khan Natasha Kerensky (who was piloting the LRM variant of her Widowmaker in the same Trial). For long range, the Lone Wolf variant was armed with shoulder mounted twin LRM-20 launchers with 24 racks, first half being Swarm LRMs, backed up by a Gauss Rifle in left arm, with 16 slug coming from bins in the left torso. For close combat, the Lone Wolf carries three Medium Pulse Lasers in right arm, a stubby LB-X Autocannon/20 with 10 cluster rounds under-slung on right torso. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.26

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
This Marauder, commonly refered as the MAD-DER, was first seen as a Solaris VII speed boosted refit which boasts of an L.A.M. System incorporated to the very mech's chassis and engine, enabling it to go faster and actually fly in short bursts. Made with that kind of passion for a flying Marauder, the design was quickly stolen and reffited with several disabler weapons. Making it a capable fast heavy support class mech. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.21

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
The Clint was first created in 2607 as a direct result of the Star LeagueArmaments Act, a law meant to provide border areas with the latest in battlefield technology. The next version, CLNT-2-3T, was mass produced starting in 2608. The Clint was primarily designed as a cheap recon unit, with the capabilities of a well-armed, low-end medium weight 'Mech, and in this regard it served well. With a top speed of 97.2 km/h and a jumping capability of one hundred and eighty meters, the Clint can easily keep up with other recon elements and maneuver through mountainous or urban terrain. Its Sloan 220 Lockover T&T System in particular shines as it is simple to use and provides the pilot with excellent battlefield data. Although the 'Mech has limited ammunition reserves for its autocannon, the Sloane 220 ensures that whatever the Clintshoots at, it hits. Quirk: Variable Range Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

content.original: The Kugelblitz, also known as the Hypernova, Superluminous Supernova, or 'Type 1A Supernova' is a gigantic Supernova chassis. Nothing really out of the ordinary until one checks the armor plating on it, mounting WarShip class 'Ferro-Carbide Lamellor', this expensive armor is capable of protecting a 'Mech's internals without issue, but the price to maintain the armor is something even the richest of Clan Diamond Shark might have an issue with. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.38

content.original:
The variant piloted by Phelan Wolf at his Trial of Position to test out as a MechWarrior on 21 July 3051. Configured by Khan Natasha Kerensky (who was piloting the LRM variant of her Widowmaker in the same Trial). For long range, the Lone Wolf variant was armed with shoulder mounted twin LRM-20 launchers with 24 racks, first half being Swarm LRMs, backed up by a Gauss Rifle in left arm, with 16 slug coming from bins in the left torso. For close combat, the Lone Wolf carries three Medium Pulse Lasers in right arm, a stubby LB-X Autocannon/20 with 10 cluster rounds under-slung on right torso. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.26

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: The Railgun is a massive weapon adapted from WarShips to be used on BattleMechs. Clan technology has allowed such a massive weapon to fit a relative small space. The powerful weapon decimates enemy 'Mechs with a single, well-placed shot, but only a few 'Mechs are able to mount. This one was specially downscaled for Assault mechs on the CT. Experimental close range firemode unlocked. Uses Railgun Ammo. VOLATILE!

content.original: The latest Railgun variant downscaled set to mountable into normal mech sized mech chassis. This versions brings a lot more improvements and a radical change in space conservation. The downside to this radical of an upgrade, is that the mech used in this, the Stone Rhino - R, has this permanently affixed into the chassis, sacrificing adaptability for role specialization. A specialized CASE system that spreads its capacitors safely around the torso makes it safer to use. Experimental close range firemode unlocked. Uses Railgun Ammo.

content.original:
A clan prototype of an even more improved Rifleman III RF2-A, further improved by a group of Clan Coyote scientists that would eventually turn into the Society. The changes start already on the chassis level by using a Composite structure, mounting a 280 XXL engine and special recoil reducing arm actuators. To utilize the actuators fully the 'Mech mounts one LB-X AC/2 and one Rotary AC/10 in each arm. Further, it uses Stealth armor, a Nova CEWS and UAV to win any sensor war to be able to get close enough to obliterate its enemies. To aid the pilot, a VR cockpit with Enhance Imaging support, and a high-end Fire Control System. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.3

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: The latest Railgun variant downscaled set to mountable into normal mech sized mech chassis. This versions brings a lot more improvements and a radical change in space conservation. The downside to this radical of an upgrade, is that the mech used in this, the Stone Rhino - R, has this permanently affixed into the chassis, sacrificing adaptability for role specialization. A specialized CASE system that spreads its capacitors safely around the torso makes it safer to use. Experimental close range firemode unlocked. Uses Railgun Ammo.

content.original:
A clan prototype of an even more improved Rifleman III RF2-A, further improved by a group of Clan Coyote scientists that would eventually turn into the Society. The changes start already on the chassis level by using a Composite structure, mounting a 280 XXL engine and special recoil reducing arm actuators. To utilize the actuators fully the 'Mech mounts one LB-X AC/2 and one Rotary AC/10 in each arm. Further, it uses Stealth armor, a Nova CEWS and UAV to win any sensor war to be able to get close enough to obliterate its enemies. To aid the pilot, a VR cockpit with Enhance Imaging support, and a high-end Fire Control System. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.3

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

This armor uses fixed slots, 2 slots on LA/LT/RT/RA and 1 slot on Head/CT/LL/RL CASE II Enabled

content.original: The latest evolution of clan armor, a project combining the work of Clan Diamond Shark around ferro-carbide lamellor armor with Clan Coyote's forray into Superheavy Mechs. Not much is known about the actual manufacturing process, but compund analysis of armord shards found on the battlefield seems to point towards a further evolution of the Ferro-Fibrous armor, which almost entirely removes the steel to lower the weight of the armor considerably. This can not be the only secret behind the armor, as previous attempts to produce similar materials proved far too fragile for use as battlemech armor.

content.original: Developed by Howa Machinery Company Ltd. for the King Dragon, the experimental Ryujin Superheavy Flamer utilizes a totally new concept for delivery of the flammable substance. The weapon charges a 'cloud' of inert nano-particles with an positive charge, which then binds a special ionized highly flammable substance between the particles. Upon impact with a surface the bindings of the nano-particles and the flammable substance are broken, resulting in the ignition of the fluid by the released electrical charge. This allows the flamer to reach much further distances, but also means the heat explosion is considerably less at shorter distances as the kinetic impact will rupture less of the bindings. If the weapon is handled incorrectly it could lead to an incorrect charging sequence resulting in the flammable substance igniting upon firing, causing a large heat explosion. Uses Superheavy Flamer Ammo.

content.original: A Clan Wolverine prototype Rotary Gauss Rifle. First Conceptualized on Project Omega, now added into a RACzilla's chassis. Generates a lot more heat for each shot fired. Has a special ''Overload'' mode, this mode shots a single superheated gauss shot which causes heavy damage to any targets, using this mode is normally not recommended since it causes heavy stress on the weapon, but helps in saving ammo. Uses Gauss Ammo. REALLY VOLATILE!

content.original: A Clan Wolverine prototype Rotary AntiPersonnel Large Bore Gauss Rifle, or RAPLBGR. With probably the worst acronym ever, this weapon is a re-conceptualization of Project Omega's Rotary Gauss Rifle, mainly made for annihilation of Elementals and infantry units, but more than capable enough to damage other mechs. Uses RAPLBGR Ammo. VOLATILE!

content.original: A highly experimental super-heavy laser, developed by a black ops skunkworks division of Kali Yama. The Mauler is a brute-force energy projector that fires a massive bolt of unrestrained destruction with a wide area of effect. The Mauler almost always strikes its target, but has very limited range and needs a long time to cool down between shots. Its very high power usage and heavy strain on hardware when firing makes the Mauler practically need a custom built chassis for mounting. VERY UNSTABLE AND VOLATILE!

content.original: In an attempt to improve the damage potential of superheavy 'Mechs the researchers at StarYard Laboratories took a Naval-class Laser and downsized the weapon until it fit on the chassis of a 'Mech. After some initial issues during the first field trials, a series of frequency modulators and micro-microphase resonators were added resulting in a pulse-like firing pattern. The results were promising enough that a limited production series was run, and although rare the weapon can now be found throughout the galaxy.

content.original: An experimental rotary missile launcher enabling firing up to three salvos in very short sequence from the 20 visible tubes. Due to issues with internal rotation mechanism jamming constantly and sometimes even misfiring, the weapon is considered highly unreliable and a failure by the MechWarriors that have trialed it. Since the launcher has to preload the ammunition into the rotary system, there is a chance of explosion if the weapon is damaged. VOLATILE!

content.original: The Yin is an experimental Rotary PPC, capable of firing one, two or three shots. To not overload the circuitry of the 'Mech when firing in the multi-shot modes, the Rotary PPC pre-loads a large amount of capacitors with the energy needed. As a result the Yin is a very large weapon that can only be mounted on superheavy 'Mechs.

content.original: The Helical Railgun is Clan Steel Viper's recent weapons technology, a further advancement of the standard linear Railgun by combining it with the latest coilgun advancements. The coils are used to charge the firing mechanism considerably faster than normal, allowing the weapon to switch between either a long range, higher damage, single shot attack, or a multi-firing sequence with two or three shots. However, due to the technology limitations the the weapon still is prohibitively heavy and large and can only fit on the largest BattleMechs, and is also prone to misfire if not the proper firing sequence of seven precise steps is used. Uses Helical Railgun Ammo. EXTREMELY VOLATILE!

content.original: The Improved Railgun is a recent creation of the Clans, using the latest Clan technology to further lower its weight. The result is a smaller and lighter weapon, that still manages to retain or even improve upon the typical characteristics of the original except for its range. To compensate for the shorter range, a new special firing mode has been developed that increases the range considerably at the cost of less damage by undercharging the firing rail. Uses Railgun Ammo. VOLATILE!

content.original: Originally a failed project by Free Worlds League for a Coaxial Hyper Velocity Railgun, ComStar acquired the technology in secret and adapted it fire plasma instead. A plasma railgun is similar to the more commonly known projectile railgun, however, the armature and ejected projectile consists of plasma, or hot, ionized, gas-like particles, instead of a solid slug of material. This produces muzzle velocities of up to several hundreds of kilometers per second, and a huge heat buildup on impact. Uses Plasma Railgun Ammo. VOLATILE!
